core_analogy: Moon = Bungee jumper जो हमेशा गिर रहा है लेकिन रस्सी (velocity) उसे side में खींचती रहती है। जितना गिरता है, उतना Earth curve हो जाती है नीचे से। तो गिरता रहता है... पर कभी पहुँचता नहीं!
subconscious_hook: Curiosity gap + Identity challenge: 'तुम्हें लगता है Moon स्थिर है? WRONG! वो हर second गिर रहा है - और ये समझना JEE/NEET के लिए CRITICAL है'

visual_scenes.01_hook: Earth center में, Moon ऊपर। Arrow दिखाओ Moon से Earth की तरफ pointing (gravity)। Text flash: 'FALLING... RIGHT NOW!' Moon slightly wobbles जैसे गिरने वाला हो। Dramatic zoom।
visual_scenes.02_setup: Newton under apple tree (simple silhouette)। Apple गिरती है। Newton looks up at Moon। Thought bubble: 'अगर apple गिरती है... तो Moon क्यों नहीं?' Question mark appears।
visual_scenes.03_content_part1: Cannon on mountain top (Newton's cannon thought experiment)। Fire cannonball - falls to ground (short arc)। Fire faster - falls further। Fire EVEN faster - goes halfway around Earth। Use MechanicsSimulator for projectile trajectories।
visual_scenes.03_content_part2: Fire at PERFECT speed - ball keeps falling but Earth curves AWAY at same rate! Ball makes complete circle। Moon replaces cannonball। Show velocity arrow (horizontal) + gravity arrow (down) = curved path। FieldVisualizer shows gravity field lines。
visual_scenes.04_reveal: Split screen: LEFT - person falling straight down। RIGHT - Moon 'falling' but missing Earth। Text: 'दोनों FALL कर रहे हैं!' Moon's path shown as continuous 'falling around' Earth। Mind-blow moment: 'Orbit = Falling + Missing!'
visual_scenes.05_key_point: Formula appears: v = √(GM/r)। Break it down visually - G (gravity constant), M (Earth mass), r (distance)। Show if v too slow = crash। If v too fast = escape। Goldilocks zone = orbit। Use simple speedometer visual।
visual_scenes.06_exam_tip: JEE 2023 question flash (orbital velocity)। Quick solve using the formula। Tip: 'याद रखो - orbital velocity depends on r, NOT on satellite mass!' Common mistake highlighted with red X।
visual_scenes.07_cta: Moon orbiting smoothly। JeetLo logo appears। 'Physics ऐसे समझो - Follow करो!' Subscribe button animation।

virality_factor: The 'falling but never landing' paradox is screenshot-worthy। The cannon animation building up speed is satisfying to rewatch। The split-screen comparison (falling person vs falling Moon) is the 'send to friend' moment।
mind_blow_moment: जब viewer realize करता है कि ORBIT means 'continuously falling but always missing' - ये brain rewire करता है। हम orbit को 'floating' समझते हैं, पर actually it's 'falling with style'!
simplification_strategy: 1) Newton's cannon = perfect visual - no jargon needed। 2) 'गिरना + चूकना = orbit' - 4 words में पूरा concept। 3) Formula AFTER intuition - पहले समझाओ WHY, फिर HOW। 4) Speedometer for velocity - everyone understands fast/slow।
logic_flow: Hook (Moon गिर रहा है!) → Setup (Newton's question) → Content Part 1 (cannon experiment - slow to fast) → Content Part 2 (perfect speed = orbit) → Reveal (falling + missing = orbit) → Key Point (formula + Goldilocks velocity) → Exam Tip (JEE relevance) → CTA

audio_notes.tone: Excited curiosity building to triumphant revelation
audio_notes.pace: Fast hook, medium teaching, dramatic pauses at reveal
